@@ -2486,6 +2486,11 @@ def random_fullrank_matrix_distinct_singular_value(l):
     s = torch.arange(1., l + 1).mul_(1.0 / (l + 1))
     return u.mm(torch.diag(s)).mm(v.t())
 
+def random_matrix_large_singular_value(m, n):
body: I think the check will work for full rank matrices, since full rank matrices are dense in the space of all matrices. This could mean that a small perturbation to the actual matrix, could with high probability land at another full rank matrix, thus causing no change in rank.
